English: Outcast (ish), one who is wingless, scorned by society, one who has betrayed their clan, one who is condemned to die
Notes: Cultural; no exact translation, considered the gravest insult to give
Often in context of ritual, show, or ceremony

English: Regalborn, royalborn, those who live within society
Notes: See árakain

English: Scale, Dragon scale, scalemail armour, plate armour
to Struggle , to strive , struggle for liberation
Water, (lake, ocean, body of still water)
Wildborn, those who live outside of society
Notes: Dragonkind is split into two groups, those who live in society (and once ruled it), and those who live in the wilderness and the mountains

English: I, We [noble, 本尊、本宫、本座]

Notes: arkhán used to be the word for duke, before it got applied to lower ranked nobility and as a general term for "Lord" or "Lady", and a new word for duke was created
khultaanin is reduced to "khultaan" in speech, though suffixes apply as if an "i" were present

English: to Start, to Open, to Begin
